Tagging Named Entities with Flair Standard Models

Source: vignettes/get_entities.Rmd
get_entities.Rmd
#>  flaiR: An R Wrapper for Accessing Flair NLP Tagging Features
#>  Python: 3.11
#>  Flair: 0.12.2
#> Using virtual environment '~/.virtualenvs/r-reticulate' ...
#> + /Users/yenchiehliao/.virtualenvs/r-reticulate/bin/python -m pip install --upgrade --no-user flair

Source: https://flairnlp.github.io/docs/tutorial-basics/tagging-entities

An Example Using ner Model (Pre-trained NER English Model)

Generic Approach Using get_entities() 

library(flaiR)
data("uk_immigration")
uk_immigration <- head(uk_immigration, 10)

Use load_tagger_ner to call the NER pretrained model. The model will be downloaded from Flairâ€™s Hugging Face repo. Thus, ensure you have an internet connection. Once downloaded, the model will be stored in .flair as the cache in your device. So, once youâ€™ve downloaded it and it hasnâ€™t been manually removed, executing the command again will not trigger a download.

tagger_pos <- flaiR::load_tagger_ner("ner")
#> 2023-09-17 19:32:05,551 SequenceTagger predicts: Dictionary with 20 tags: <unk>, O, S-ORG, S-MISC, B-PER, E-PER, S-LOC, B-ORG, E-ORG, I-PER, S-PER, B-MISC, I-MISC, E-MISC, I-ORG, B-LOC, E-LOC, I-LOC, <START>, <STOP>

If you want the computation to run faster, it is recommended to keep the show.text_id set to FALSE by default.

time <- system.time({
    results <- get_entities(uk_immigration$text,
                            uk_immigration$speaker, 
                            tagger_pos,
                            show.text_id = FALSE
                            )
    gc()
})

print(time)
#>    user  system elapsed 
#>  25.171   0.409  25.412

print(results)
#>               doc_id                          entity  tag
#>  1: Philip Hollobone                    Conservative  ORG

Batch Processing Using get_entities_batch() 

batch_process_time <- system.time({
    batch_process_results  <- get_entities_batch(uk_immigration$text,
                                                 uk_immigration$speaker, 
                                                 tagger_pos, 
                                                 show.text_id = FALSE,
                                                 batch_size = 2)
    gc()
})
#> CPU is used.
print(batch_process_time)
#>    user  system elapsed 
#>  24.769   0.365  25.015
print(batch_process_results)
#>               doc_id                          entity  tag text_id
